Additional forms: Also Gondi_Mu caus.hunjih-; Gondi_Muhuskaṛsleep; Gondi_Elwinhuskār, Gondi_Mauskaṛ,uskanḍid.
Also Gondi_Trkanskstānāto send a dream (of god); Gondi_A (SR)kanjkānāto dream

Notes: The Gondi_Lu_S form is more archaic, as is shown by external data. The form itself literally means 'curved arm' (*kōnd-+*kāy-) and has undergone modifications in Gondi dialects, primarily in the direction*-ndk->*-nadk->*-naŋk-, although the reason of*-o->-u-is not quite clear (probably due to surrounding back consonants).

Additional forms: Most dialects havemara; also Gondi_Mumaṛa naya kind of animal living on trees; Gondi_Komāṛ nēywild dog
Also Gondi_Amiṛc-to lighten; Gondi_A (Su.)miṛc-to glitter;miṛcvallightning; Gondi_Lu_Smeersheetattalightning; Gondi_Mamiṛŋgor̨spark; Gondi_A (Su.)minŋūṛspark

Also Gondi_Trmuṛhuttānāto plunge (tr.); Gondi_Wmuriānā(sun) to set; Gondi_Ph caus.murīsahtānā,murahtānā; Gondi_Mmuṛndānāto sink, be drowned; Gondi_Ko (Su.)mu-to immerse (tr.); Gondi_A (Su.)muḍḍūŋ-to be immersed;muḍḍūs-to immerse

Notes: The syncopation here is similar to the process in*nelenǯ"moon" q.v.

Word: pukee "a portion split from a bamboo"
Additional forms: Also Gondi_Mupayih-/pah-,Gondi_Wpaiyatānā,paihatānā, Gondi_Phpaiyahtānā,paisahtānā, Gondi_Kopah-to split (tr.); Gondi_Trpakkī, Gondi_W, Gondi_Phpahkī, Gondi_Mupaki, Gondi_Kopaksplit bamboo
Also Gondi_Trpūrāl-kāṭāa kind of thin, poor grass

Meaning: necklace of black beads worn by women

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Trsanne-mīārsister's daughter;sannē-marrīsister's son;sēlār-sannēyounger sister's husband; Gondi_A (SR)saṇeyounger sister's husband; Gondi_A (ASu.)saṛēson-in-law

Notes: External data points toc-; in Koya0-would be expected, but, since it is not pure Koya, but KoyaSu., anything can be expected.
In Gondi_A (SR)javukānāinitialj-probably by contamination with*jok-to kill (2831).
